wikipedia_page.main: David C. Chalmers (22 July 1891 – 24 April 1920) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a centre forward in the Scottish League for Kilmarnock, Third Lanark and Raith Rovers. He also played in the Football League for Grimsby Town.

response: David Chalmers is an Australian philosopher.
David Chalmers may also refer to:
* David Chalmers (footballer, born 1891) (1891–1920), Scottish football centre forward
* David Chalmers (footballer, born 1897) (1897–1961), Scottish football inside forward
* David Chalmers, Lord Ormond (1530-1592) Scottish law lord and historian and figure of the Scottish Reformation

David Chalmers (1897 – 1961) was a Scottish footballer who played as an inside left for Clydebank in the first and second tiers of the Scottish Football League during the 1920s, playing alongside Jimmy McGrory for a season.Original Clydebank 1914-1932  The Players, Clydebank FC Programmes He had earlier played for Junior side St Anthony's and been selected to play for Scotland at that level.Internationalists, Antshistory
